messages: f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (13:36): The webstorage spec appears ambiguous:  http://dev.w3.org/html5/webstorage/, consider the following:
f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (13:36): storage.setItem("0", "foo");
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:37): webidl defines the precedence order
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:46): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: any idea why I get this_should_never_appear_publicly element in the tree after parsing?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:46): If that's the element I think it is, because I created a bug.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:47): Oh, no, not my bug.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:47): Um, what's the input? File a bug on that.
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:49): tostring(html5lib.parse('<html></html>', treebuilder="lxml"))
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:49): produces

f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:49): '<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/loose.dtd">\n<html:html xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><body><this_should_never_appear_publicly/></body><html:head/><html:body/></html:html>
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:50): Um, that's bad.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:50): What version of lxml?
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:51): dont understand how the tests are passing
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:51): has never seen that
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:51): I don't understand how that element can get there
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:51): lxml-2.3dev-py2.6-linux-i686.egg
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:52): What is tostring?

f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (13:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: are you sure it is defined? "If an object implements more than one interface that defines a given special operation, then it is undefined which (if any) special operation is invoked."
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:52): lxml.etree.tostring
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:53): I get '<html:html xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><html:head/><html:body/></html:html>'
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:53): with lxml 2.2.2, I think
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (13:54): this isn't a lxml problem though is it?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:54): I'd presume it's a change in lxml's behaviour
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:55): f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716: there's only one interface involved here though right?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:55): I get the right output with lxml 2.2.4
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:55): (Not necessarily lxml's problem - html5lib might be relying on non-guaranteed behaviour here)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:55): So it seems like a 2.3 change
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:55): (although arguably it's lxml's problem that html5lib has to rely on non-guaranteed behaviour)
f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (13:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: right, i just can't see where in webidl that is actually defined
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:58): has no recollection of why that magic tag has to be inserted
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:59): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Creating a DOCTYPE is impossible in lxml apart from at parse-time
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:01): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Yes, I remember that much
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:02): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: And to parse anything you need a well-formed XML document, which requires a root element
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:02): The point of calling it that and not "html" is to make sure the tag name is correctly changed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:02): f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716: in the [Get] definition, probably.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:03): f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716: if it's not defined, see the status section of the webidl spec for where to send comments
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:03): so that we can get it defined :-)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:05): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: But won't lxml complain about the mismatch between <!doctype html> and the root element name?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:05): (well obviously it didn't, but they are supposed to match, no)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:05): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: no, that's a validity constraint, not a well-formedness constraint
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:05): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: It only enforces valdiity constraints if you enable them.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:06): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: But the whole point of doing things like this was to get the right information into the dtd object
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:06): Do we actually get that right now?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:07): AFAIK yes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:07): it looks like we at least partially do
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (14:09): is the workaround to downgrade lxml?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:09): f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492: Hopefully that will work
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (14:10): ok thanks
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:11): What I really don't get is how it ends up as a child of body
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (14:13): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: it's done in one of the parse phases
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:14): None should move the root element, ever
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:17): -> in Oslo
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:17): Now that I've run away :P
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:20): seemed better that way
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (14:27): yeah, downgrading lxml sorts it
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:28): f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492: Could you file a bug please? I will try to investigate
f82ff3e4224ee2faf7117d6787f0e492 (14:30): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: on code.google.com?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:14): is anyone actually ever using the filtering options HTML5 tracker provides?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:14): I personally just find the color coding useful but the form feels like clutter
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:18): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I've sometimes used the tools and conformance checker filters
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:19): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: though more often using my forked script than your instance
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:20): I'm going to comment it out and see who starts yelling
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:27): cleaned up http://html5.org/tools/web-apps-tracker a little bit
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:27): arguably it should be called Web Applications 1.0 Revision Tracker but this seems good enough
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:44): grrr. I had forgotten Java has a 2^16 byte limit for the size of the static initializer
